metadata.title: CVE-2023-52594 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:wifi: ath9k: Fix potential array-index-out-of-bounds read inath9k_htc_txstatus()Fix an array-index-out-of-bounds read in ath9k_htc_txstatus(). The bugoccurs when txs->cnt, data from a URB provided by a USB device, isbigger than the size of the array txs->txstatus, which isHTC_MAX_TX_STATUS. WARN_ON() already checks it, but there is no bughandling code after the check. Make the function return if that is thecase.Found by a modified version of syzkaller.UBSAN: array-index-out-of-bounds in htc_drv_txrx.cindex 13 is out of range for type '__wmi_event_txstatus [12]'Call Trace: ath9k_htc_txstatus ath9k_wmi_event_tasklet tasklet_action_common __do_softirq irq_exit_rxu sysvec_apic_timer_interrupt

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
